page.title: 18Clearwell
page.content: CLEARWELL IS LOCATED 5 MILES WEST OF THE RIVER WYE AND 10 MILES EAST OF THE RIVER SEVERN LIEING 2 MILES SOUTH SOUTH WEST OF ITS NEAREST TOWN OF COLEFORD.ITS ALTITUDE IS ABOUT 150 METRES ABOVE SEA LEVEL AS THE WHOLE OF THE FOREST OF DEAN IS LOCATED ON A PLATEAU OF EXTREMLY OLD AND HARD ROCK. CLEARWELL IS A VERY OLD VILLAGE AS ITS HISTORY SHOWES. IT HOUSES ENGLANDS FIRST NEOGOTHIC MANSION AND A MAZE OF UNDERGROUND TUNNELS WHICH WERE ONCE AN ANCIENT IRON MINE.THE VILLAGE GETS ITS NAME FROM A WELL OF CLEAR WATER.IN THE MIDDLE AGES FIRST REFERENCE WAS OF CLOUERWELLE,THIS BECAME CLEARWELL.A FEW YEARS AGO IT WAS A DYING VILLAGE BUT NOW DUE TO STRANGERS COMING TO WORK HERE IT HAS BECOME VERY POPULAR TO LIVE IN.
